info.title: Svix API
info.description:
Welcome to the Svix API documentation!

Useful links: [Homepage](https://www.svix.com) | [Support email](mailto:support+docs@svix.com) | [Slack Community](https://www.svix.com/slack/)

# Introduction

This is the reference documentation and schemas for the Svix API. For tutorials and other documentation please refer to [the documentation](https://docs.svix.com).

## Main concepts

In Svix you have four important entities you will be interacting with:

- `messages`: these are the webhooks being sent. They can have contents and a few other properties.
- `application`: this is where `messages` are sent to. Usually you want to create one application for each of your users.
- `endpoint`: endpoints are the URLs messages will be sent to. Each application can have multiple `endpoints` and each message sent to that application will be sent to all of them (unless they are not subscribed to the sent event type).
- `event-type`: event types are identifiers denoting the type of the message being sent. Event types are primarily used to decide which events are sent to which endpoint.


## Authentication

Get your authentication token (`AUTH_TOKEN`) from the [Svix dashboard](https://dashboard.svix.com) and use it as part of the `Authorization` header as such: `Authorization: Bearer ${AUTH_TOKEN}`.

<SecurityDefinitions />


## Code samples

The code samples assume you already have the respective libraries installed and you know how to use them. For the latest information on how to do that, please refer to [the documentation](https://docs.svix.com/).


## Cross-Origin Resource Sharing

This API features Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) implemented in compliance with [W3C spec](https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/). And that allows cross-domain communication from the browser. All responses have a wildcard same-origin which makes them completely public and accessible to everyone, including any code on any site.

get.description: Verify the API server is up and running.
List of all the organization's applications.

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
application_out = svix.application.create(ApplicationIn(
    uid="unique-app-identifier",
    name="My first application"
))

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Java
x-codeSamples.source:
ApplicationOut applicationOut = svix.getApplication().create(new ApplicationIn()
    .uid("unique-app-identifier"),
    .name("My first application")
)

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://api.svix.com/api/v1/app/' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'
  -d '{
    "uid": "unique-app-identifier",
    "name": "My first application"
}'

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
application_out = svix.application.update('app_id', ApplicationIn(
    uid="unique-app-identifier",
    name="My first application"
))

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Kotlin
x-codeSamples.source:
val applicationOut = svix.application.update('app_id', ApplicationIn()
    .uid("unique-app-identifier"),
    .name("My first application")
)

x-codeSamples.label: Java
x-codeSamples.source:
ApplicationOut applicationOut = svix.getApplication().update('app_id', new ApplicationIn()
    .uid("unique-app-identifier"),
    .name("My first application")
)

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X 'PUT' \
  'https://api.svix.com/api/v1/app/{app_id}/' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'
  -d '{
    "uid": "unique-app-identifier",
    "name": "My first application"
}'

post.description: Use this function to get magic links (and authentication codes) for connecting your users to the management UIs.

Logout an app token.

Trying to log out other tokens will fail.

get.description: Return the list of event types.

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
event_type_out = svix.event_type.create(EventTypeIn(
    description="A user has signed up",
    name="user.signup"
))

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Kotlin
x-codeSamples.source:
val eventTypeOut = svix.eventType.create(EventTypeIn()
    .description("A user has signed up"),
    .name("user.signup")
)

x-codeSamples.label: Java
x-codeSamples.source:
EventTypeOut eventTypeOut = svix.getEventType().create(new EventTypeIn()
    .description("A user has signed up"),
    .name("user.signup")
)

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://api.svix.com/api/v1/event-type/' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'
  -d '{
    "description": "A user has signed up",
    "name": "user.signup"
}'

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
Go
Kotlin
Java
CLI
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X 'PUT' \
  'https://api.svix.com/api/v1/event-type/{event_type_name}/' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'
  -d '{
    "description": "A user has signed up"
}'

post.description: Create a new endpoint for the application.

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
endpoint_out = svix.endpoint.create('app_id', EndpointIn(
    url="https://example.com/webhook/",
    version=1,
    description="An example endpoint name",
    filter_types=['user.signup', 'user.deleted']
))

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Kotlin
x-codeSamples.source:
val endpointOut = svix.endpoint.create('app_id', EndpointIn()
    .url("https://example.com/webhook/"),
    .version(1),
    .description("An example endpoint name"),
    .filterTypes(arrayOf("user.signup", "user.deleted"))
)

x-codeSamples.label: Java
x-codeSamples.source:
EndpointOut endpointOut = svix.getEndpoint().create('app_id', new EndpointIn()
    .url("https://example.com/webhook/"),
    .version(1),
    .description("An example endpoint name"),
    .filterTypes(new String[]{"user.signup", "user.deleted"})
)

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://api.svix.com/api/v1/app/{app_id}/endpoint/' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'
  -d '{
    "url": "https://example.com/webhook/",
    "version": 1,
    "description": "An example endpoint name",
    "filterTypes": [
        "user.signup",
        "user.deleted"
    ]
}'

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
endpoint_out = svix.endpoint.update('app_id', 'endpoint_id', EndpointIn(
    url="https://example.com/webhook/",
    version=1,
    description="An example endpoint name",
    filter_types=['user.signup', 'user.deleted']
))

x-codeSamples.label: Go
Kotlin
x-codeSamples.source:
val endpointOut = svix.endpoint.update('app_id', 'endpoint_id', EndpointIn()
    .url("https://example.com/webhook/"),
    .version(1),
    .description("An example endpoint name"),
    .filterTypes(arrayOf("user.signup", "user.deleted"))
)

x-codeSamples.label: Java
x-codeSamples.source:
EndpointOut endpointOut = svix.getEndpoint().update('app_id', 'endpoint_id', new EndpointIn()
    .url("https://example.com/webhook/"),
    .version(1),
    .description("An example endpoint name"),
    .filterTypes(new String[]{"user.signup", "user.deleted"})
)

x-codeSamples.label: CLI
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X 'PUT' \
  'https://api.svix.com/api/v1/app/{app_id}/endpoint/{endpoint_id}/' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'
  -d '{
    "url": "https://example.com/webhook/",
    "version": 1,
    "description": "An example endpoint name",
    "filterTypes": [
        "user.signup",
        "user.deleted"
    ]
}'

get.description:
Get the endpoint's signing secret.

This is used to verify the authenticity of the webhook.
For more information please refer to [the consuming webhooks docs](https://docs.svix.com/consuming-webhooks/).
List all of the application's messages.

post.description:
Creates a new message and dispatch it to all of the application's endpoints. The message will be delivered following the organizations delivery and retry policy.
`eventId` Is an optional global unique ID accross all applications.
If a message with the same `eventId` already exists, a 409 conflict error will be returned.

x-codeSamples.label: Python
Go

get.description: Get a message by its ID or eventID.

List the message attempts for a particular endpoint.

Returning the message.
`msg_id`: Use a message id or a message `eventId`

post.description: Resend a message to the specified endpoint.

get.description:
List the message attempts for a particular endpoint.

Returning the endpint.
`msg_id`: Use a message id or a message `eventId`
`msg_id`: Use a message id or a message `eventId`

MessageStatus.title: MessageStatus
MessageStatus.description:
The sending status of the message:
- Success = 0
- Pending = 1
- Fail = 2
